reviewText: Terrible
It was ok... the subtitles were our if place the whole time.

Don't know why cos I love Bollywood movies but this one was just not good; it looked like it should be good, could be good, but it kept turning me off over and over and I'm groaning, "Oh, India, don't turn into this superficial, flashy money princess blah blah blah stupid humor horrible and 'unbelievable cruel stepmother..., awful acting, so fake. Even the great Shahid Kapoor couldn't shine enough to keep my interest. I like sweet movies, I don't need a fabulous storyline, ... but this was just really not a good movie in my opinion. Lacked class, cultural uniqueness, good acting, believe-ability, I could go on and on. If I hadn't seen so many good, even if medium / ordinary but sweet and great Indian films, even then I couldn't like this; but it was especially disappointing as I see this trend developing of mindless downhill empty fake movies coming out lately, something like Om Shanti Om, where even great stars don't have a chance to shine. But that's just me. Maybe some will like it, who knows. Age group 11-13?
It was cute and whimsical.
I have no idea why Shahid Kapoor singe this movie.
One of the most nonsensical movie.

This movie is The BOMB! It will go down in my video collection as The modern day Bollywood version of Animal House, with a twist of Mushrooms! (This is not for kids) it's also not your typical, corny, sappy singing dancing cliche movie. The music in this is fantastic as well! Get your friends together, and watch this!!! BEST COMEDY OUT OF BOLLYWOOD, EVER!
I liked the quirkiness of this movie. I live Ali and Shahid.
Such a disappointing movie, especially for one with Shahid Kapoor.  Story line was weak and easily predicted.
Nice comedy

A very offbeat film, which may not be for everyone. While the tackle some serious issues, but the over all feel is dreamy and magical. Great debut for Sanah Kapoor. Even though it didn't do well at the box office, I loved it.

Very weak script. Funny moments are few and far between. Definitely a lousy soundtrack. You'd think that Shahid Kapoor and Alia Bhatt would be more choosy about the scripts they accept... Not worth watching.
Loved it so cute
Better than expected. Great acting, but not enough dance/sing numbers. And the ending was really weird. I was left confused and wanting to know what happened to Aesha.
Wasn't worth the time.  Although Shahid and Alia give OK performances, the plot was so unforgettable that I'm having difficulty recalling it.
I love Hindi movies but this one was a big disappointment.
